duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive patient care in medical-surgical and oncological settings, with a focus on oncology, hematology, and palliative care.
Administer chemotherapy and manage care for patients with complex medical needs, including diagnosis and treatment of AML, CML, leukemia, and sickle cell diseases.
Communicate effectively with healthcare teams, patients, and families to ensure optimal care and support.
Participate in interdisciplinary collaboration and coordination to deliver holistic and compassionate care to patients and families.
Maintain accurate patient records, administer medications, and monitor patient responses to treatment plans.
Support patients and families in navigating the challenges of diagnosis, treatment, and end-of-life care, demonstrating empathy and understanding.

education_certification.credential: Current Michigan Nursing License – Graduate Nurses invited to apply. Graduation from accredited nursing program. BSN degree preferred or must agree in writing to obtain a BSN within five years.
